predicate.note: Frames file for 'incur' based on sentences in financial subcorpus. No verbnet entry. Comparison with 'suffer'.

example.name: active
example.text: Or he might have *trace* to incur a huge expense of either buying Mr. Icahn's stock, possibly at a premium, or paying stockholders a special dividend partly because of Mr. Icahn's pressure.
example.arg: a huge expense of either buying Mr. Icahn's stock, possibly at a premium, or paying stockholders a special dividend partly because of Mr. Icahn's pressure

example.name: with cause of penalty
example.text: The law could redound to the advantage of brokers and banks, who *trace* incur high administrative costs to deliver securities to investors.

example.name: automatically generated
example.text: Takeover stock speculators have incurred paper losses of over $700 million from the failed UAL offer, their worst loss ever on a single deal.
example.arg: their worst loss ever on a single deal

example.name: passivized
example.text: The company also said expenses incurred *trace* by the previous board and management in the recent contest for control were recognized primarily in the first quarter ended Sept. 30.
example.arg: in the recent contest for control
